summary:
Today was a tough, yet constructive, day as a homeowner.

summary:
News:
A sponge made of cotton and squid bone that has absorbed about 99. 9% of microplastics in water samples in China could provide an elusive answer to ubiquitous microplastic pollution in water across the globe, a new report suggests. 
[…]
The study tested the material in an irrigation ditch, a lake, seawater and a pond, where it removed up to 99...
title: Friday Squid Blogging: Cotton-and-Squid-Bone Sponge
